Key Arguments: The legislation gives too much power to ACMA, a non-elected body, to decide what constitutes misinformation and disinformation.
The government has exempted itself from the legislation, allowing it to disseminate unchecked information.
The legislation infringes on basic human rights, particularly freedom of speech.
The timing of the legislation is suspicious, coinciding with the upcoming vote on The Voice referendum.
Notable Quotes: This legislation gives the Government or their appointed bureaucrats in ACMA the authority to decide what the peoples thoughts and opinions should be and to impose penalties for them expressing these.
If this legislation goes ahead, it will be the end of Australia as we know it. It will be akin to the Communist Government in China. Democracy will be dead.
